newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Zitel down to $40-1/2.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Zitel down to $40-1/2.

text.p: Zitel Corp's stock slipped 1/2 to land at $40-1/2 in after-hours trading following a brief surge earlier in the day, traders said Monday.
Rumors spread throughout the market about Soros Fund Management's plans to buy a stake in the company. The fund later dismissed the rumors.
Iomega Corp was also active, hovering at $16, another trader said.
The New York Stock Exchange said volume for session one was 47,600 shares. There was no session two. On Friday, session one had 26,400 shares and session two had 1,301,300.
